basic.description: This course will introduce the students to legal traditions of the world. The aim of the course is to better enable students to participate in a global society by becoming more aware of the different legal traditions around the world and within Canada. Legal traditions that may be discussed are: indigenous, Talmudic, civil law, Islamic, common law, Hindu and Asian. Themes that may be considered are: the concepts of legal culture and tradition, comparative law and method, legal pluralism, multiculturalism, the decline of the homogenous nation-state and the rise of the decentralized state whose citizens have multiple loyalty references, and the impact of globalisation on the law.  (To be offered jointly with LAW-650). Not offered in 2010-2011.
basic.subject: LAW
basic.title: Comparative Legal Traditions
